intro: Stapfiella claoxyloides, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant is evergreen and prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil. It is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements. Stapfiella claoxyloides is also known for its ability to thrive in humid environments.
